heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 5th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 9799 lux) and cloud levels (up 633 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10833 lux), cloud levels (up 1117 m), feels like temperature (up 2.7°C), and outside temperature (up 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 632.5m lower than yesterday, 594.4m lower than the past week, 1117.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 850m minimum and 2900m maximum, with an average of 914.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1508.5m and 2030m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and light levels will be low during the day. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
